intro: Sida humilis, commonly known as the common sida, is a low-growing annual herb native to the Americas. It typically reaches heights of about 10 to 30 centimeters and has small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are usually oval or lance-shaped with serrated edges. Its flowers are often visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological role. Sida humilis is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
